trans-unit.source: Get started with push notifications (Android JavaScript) | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Get started with push notifications (Android JavaScript) | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Azure Mobile Services to send push notifications to your Android JavaScript app.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Azure Mobile Services to send push notifications to your Android JavaScript app.

trans-unit.source: Add push notifications to your Mobile Services Android app
trans-unit.target: Add push notifications to your Mobile Services Android app

trans-unit.source: Summary
trans-unit.target: Summary

trans-unit.source: This topic shows how to use Azure Mobile Services to send push notifications to your Android app using Google Cloud Messaging ("GCM").
trans-unit.target: This topic shows how to use Azure Mobile Services to send push notifications to your Android app using Google Cloud Messaging ("GCM").

trans-unit.source: You will add push notifications to the quickstart project that is a prerequisite for this tutorial.
trans-unit.target: You will add push notifications to the quickstart project that is a prerequisite for this tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Push notifications are enabled by using the Azure Notification Hub that is included in your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: Push notifications are enabled by using the Azure Notification Hub that is included in your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: When complete, your mobile service will send a push notification each time a record is inserted.
trans-unit.target: When complete, your mobile service will send a push notification each time a record is inserted.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Enable Google Cloud Messaging
trans-unit.target: Enable Google Cloud Messaging

trans-unit.source: Configure Mobile Services to send push requests
trans-unit.target: Configure Mobile Services to send push requests

trans-unit.source: Add push notifications to your app
trans-unit.target: Add push notifications to your app

trans-unit.source: Your next step is to install Google Play services.
trans-unit.target: Your next step is to install Google Play services.

trans-unit.source: Google Cloud Messaging has some minimum API level requirements for development and testing, which the **minSdkVersion** property in the Manifest must conform to.
trans-unit.target: Google Cloud Messaging has some minimum API level requirements for development and testing, which the **minSdkVersion** property in the Manifest must conform to.

trans-unit.source: If you will be testing with an older device, then consult [Set Up Google Play Services SDK] to determine how low you can set this value, and set it appropriately.
trans-unit.target: If you will be testing with an older device, then consult [Set Up Google Play Services SDK] to determine how low you can set this value, and set it appropriately.

trans-unit.source: Add Google Play Services to the project
trans-unit.target: Add Google Play Services to the project

trans-unit.source: Add code
trans-unit.target: Add code

trans-unit.source: Update the registered insert script in the Management Portal
trans-unit.target: Update the registered insert script in the Management Portal

trans-unit.source: Test push notifications in your app
trans-unit.target: Test push notifications in your app

trans-unit.source: You can test the app by directly attaching an Android phone with a USB cable, or by using a virtual device in the emulator.
trans-unit.target: You can test the app by directly attaching an Android phone with a USB cable, or by using a virtual device in the emulator.

trans-unit.source: Setting up the Android emulator for testing
trans-unit.target: Setting up the Android emulator for testing

trans-unit.source: When you run this app in the emulator, make sure that you use an Android Virtual Device (AVD) that supports Google APIs.
trans-unit.target: When you run this app in the emulator, make sure that you use an Android Virtual Device (AVD) that supports Google APIs.

trans-unit.source: From the right end of the toolbar, select the Android Virtual Device Manager, select your device, click the edit icon on the right.
trans-unit.target: From the right end of the toolbar, select the Android Virtual Device Manager, select your device, click the edit icon on the right.

trans-unit.source: Select **Change** on the device description line, select **Google APIs**, then click OK.
trans-unit.target: Select **Change** on the device description line, select **Google APIs**, then click OK.

trans-unit.source: This targets the AVD to use Google APIs.
trans-unit.target: This targets the AVD to use Google APIs.

trans-unit.source: Running the test
trans-unit.target: Running the test

trans-unit.source: From the **Run** menu item, click **Run app** to start the app.
trans-unit.target: From the **Run** menu item, click **Run app** to start the app.

trans-unit.source: In the app, type meaningful text, such as _A new Mobile Services task_ and then click the **Add** button.
trans-unit.target: In the app, type meaningful text, such as _A new Mobile Services task_ and then click the **Add** button.

trans-unit.source: Swipe down from the top of the screen to open the device's Notification Drawer to see the notification.
trans-unit.target: Swipe down from the top of the screen to open the device's Notification Drawer to see the notification.

trans-unit.source: You have successfully completed this tutorial.
trans-unit.target: You have successfully completed this tutorial.

trans-unit.target: Troubleshooting

trans-unit.target: Verify Android SDK Version

trans-unit.target: Older Code Versions

trans-unit.target: If you would like to see the Eclipse version of this tutorial, go to [Get started with push notifications (Eclipse)].
